intro: Grumilea nudiflora, commonly known as the naked-flowered grumihua, is a unique member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are often adorned with intricate patterns and vibrant colors. The plant is native to the Andean regions of South America, where it thrives in high-altitude environments. Its leaves are typically large and palmate, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Grumilea nudiflora is considered a valuable but endangered species in botanical collections.
